value.title: Decompress gzip files using Power BI and get access to @EU_Eurostat data.
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to access Eurostat open data using power bi.  Most data is stored in gzip files and you need to know how to decompress gzip files to be able to get the data. I will show you two methods in this video.  Link to Eurostat data portal: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database?node_code=demo_gind

value.title: Differences between Power BI Apps and Workspaces
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you the difference between Power Bi Apps and workspaces and what do I use them for. I also explain why I think that workspaces are too messy for the business user or data consumer.  Links to resources mentioned in the video: The new App Navigation video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Bo0HHUcuas

value.title: Dynamically find header rows and promote them in Power Query
value.excerpt: Dynamically find a column header and promote them in power query is  a very common requirement, specially if you are importing data from excel or pdfs for example.  In today's video, I will show you how to do that with just a few simple steps!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: How to add ANNOTATIONS to a chart in Power BI to provide an explanation or more context!
value.excerpt: Annotations on charts are helpful for showing when key events occurred, especially when they have a noticeable impact on the data  or to give insights on the numbers in text form to help the reader understand the chart.  In todays video I will show you can you can add annotations to charts automatically

value.title: How to create functions in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to create a custom function in Power Query.  Custom functions are re-usable pieces of code.
